medical_history.chief_complaint: Ms. ___ presents with nausea, fatigue, and increased pigtail drainage.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient noted increased drainage over the past ___ days, with the drain typically putting out ___ overnight but recently noticed around 20cc. Increased drainage correlated with worsening nausea; patient denies fevers, chills, vomiting, diarrhea, and constipation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: COPD, pulmonary hypertension, CHF, severe obstructive sleep apnea, diabetes mellitus, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, perforated sigmoid diverticulitis s/p pigtail catheter, severe aortic stenosis s/p TAVR, chronic diastolic heart failure with EF 60-65%, gastroesophageal reflux disease, obesity, psoriasis, left bundle branch block.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of brain injury related to a fall, mother died of myocardial infarction at age ___, brother died of myocardial infarction at age ___, sister with ___ at age ___.
